body_html:
Could you set the CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environmental variable to limit the GPU that is visible to TensorFlow?

TensorFlow by default grabs all the GPUs visible to it, and grabs all the memory for suballocation. The user can configure how much memory it should ask. But 8G is definitely enough. The segfault is a bit troubling. If CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES doesn't fix any of this problem, we can ask the stream-executor team to investigate further.
